solution.text:
Curved surface area (CSA) = \(2\pi rh\)
Total surface area = \(2\pi r (r+h) = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 3 \times CSA = _{{j*j*22*7*3}}_\)
Therefore, \(2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 6\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow 2\pi r^2 = 4\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 2h\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2}\)
\(CSA = \frac{_{{j*j*22*7*3}}_}3 = 2\pi rh = 2\pi r(\frac {r}{2}) = \pi r^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area of Base = \(\pi r^2 = \frac{_{{j*j*22*7*3}}_}3\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2 = \frac {_{{j*j*22*7*3}}_\times 7}{3\times 22}\)
\(\Rightarrow r = _{{j*7}}_ cm\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2} = _{{j*7*Decimal('0.5')}}_ cm\)
Therefore, volume \(= \pi r^2h = _{{22 * (j*j*7) * (j*7*Decimal('0.5'))}}_ cm^3\)

content.text: A solid cylinder has total surface area of _{{j*j*22*7*3}}_ square centimetres. Its curved surface area is one-third of its total surface area. Find the volume of the cylinder
